definitions.definition: An act of springing : a leap , a jump .
The season of the year in temperate regions in which temperatures and daylight hours rise, and plants spring from the ground and into bloom and dormant animals spring to life .
examples: Spring is the time of the year most species reproduce.
You can visit me in the spring , when the weather is bearable.

subdefinitions.definition: The period from the moment of vernal equinox ( around March 21 in the Northern Hemisphere ) to the moment of the summer solstice ( around June 21); the equivalent periods reckoned in other cultures and calendars .
examples: Chinese New Year always occurs in January or February but is called the " Spring Festival " throughout East Asia because it is reckoned as the beginning of their spring .

subdefinitions.definition: The three months of March , April , and May in the Northern Hemisphere and September , October , and November in the Southern Hemisphere .
examples: I spent my spring holidays in Morocco.
The spring issue will be out next week.

definitions.definition: The time of something 's growth ; the early stages of some process .

subdefinitions.definition: a period of political liberalization and democratization

definitions.definition: Someone with ivory or peach skin tone and eyes and hair that are not extremely dark, seen as best suited to certain colors of clothing.
Something which springs , springs forth, springs up , or springs back , particularly

subdefinitions.definition: A spray or body of water springing from the ground .
examples: This beer was brewed with pure spring water .

subdefinitions.definition: The rising of the sea at high tide .
Ellipsis of spring tide , the especially high tide shortly after full and new moons .

An elastic mechanical part or device in any shape (e.g., flat , curved , coiled ), made of flexible material (usually spring steel ) that exerts force and attempts to spring back when bent , compressed , or stretched .
examples: We jumped so hard the bed springs broke.

subdefinitions.definition: A line from a vessel 's end or side to its anchor cable used to diminish or control its movement .
A line laid out from a vessel 's end to the opposite end of an adjacent vessel or mooring to diminish or control its movement .
examples: You should put a couple of springs onto the jetty to stop the boat moving so much.

subdefinitions.definition: A grove of trees ; a forest .

definitions.definition: An erection of the penis . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
A crack which has sprung up in a mast , spar , or ( rare ) a plank or seam .
Springiness : an attribute or quality of springing , springing up , or springing back , particularly

subdefinitions.definition: Elasticity : the property of a body springing back to its original form after compression , stretching , etc.

definitions.definition: The source from which an action or supply of something springs .
Something which causes others or another to spring forth or spring into action , particularly

main_definition: ( countable ) An act of springing : a leap , a jump .
secondary_definitions: ( countable , uncountable ) The season of the year in temperate regions in which temperatures and daylight hours rise, and plants spring from the ground and into bloom and dormant animals spring to life .
( uncountable , figurative ) The time of something 's growth ; the early stages of some process .
( countable , fashion ) Someone with ivory or peach skin tone and eyes and hair that are not extremely dark, seen as best suited to certain colors of clothing.
( countable ) Something which springs , springs forth, springs up , or springs back , particularly
( countable , slang ) An erection of the penis . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
( countable , nautical , obsolete ) A crack which has sprung up in a mast , spar , or ( rare ) a plank or seam .
( uncountable ) Springiness : an attribute or quality of springing , springing up , or springing back , particularly
( countable ) The source from which an action or supply of something springs .
( countable ) Something which causes others or another to spring forth or spring into action , particularly
